summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) staff discussing press guidance and logistical planning for the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes internal coordination about courtroom timing, press access, and details about witness pseudonyms and the charges against Maxwell.

persons.name: Janis Echenberg
persons.context: SDNY staff member coordinating press guidance and trial logistics for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

persons.name: Nicholas Biase
persons.context: SDNY staff member, likely in the press office, planning media coverage and inquiring about trial timing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant on trial, charged with conspiring with Jeffrey Epstein to entice and traffic minors for illegal sexual activity.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the co-conspirator with Ghislaine Maxwell in the charges of enticing minors and sex trafficking.

persons.name: Alison Nathan
persons.context: Presiding judge over the U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell trial at the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse.

connections.description: Charged with conspiring together to entice minors to travel to engage in illegal sex acts and sex trafficking.
SDNY colleagues coordinating press guidance and logistics for the Maxwell trial via email.
Both are points of contact for media regarding exhibit access for the trial.

events.title: Jury Charge and Opening Statements in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Planned jury charge followed by opening statements in the trial of Ghislaine Maxwell before Judge Alison Nathan.

events.title: Final Pretrial Conference in U.S. v. Maxwell
events.description: Final pretrial conference held for the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: Courtroom 318, 40 Foley Square, Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse, New York, NY
Overflow Courtrooms 110, 506, 905, and 906 of the Thurgood Marshall U.S. Courthouse
keyFacts: The court granted a government motion allowing several witnesses to testify using pseudonyms to protect the identities of alleged victims.
Ghislaine Maxwell faced six charges including conspiracy to entice minors, transportation of minors, and sex trafficking, with maximum prison sentences ranging from 5 to 40 years.
Government exhibits for the trial were provided exclusively through an SDNY file share, requiring media to establish access accounts.
The email chain reveals internal DOJ planning for press handling and courtroom logistics during a high-profile trial.
The document specifies that the jury and parties were expected to be present at 8:30 AM on November 26, 2021, with proceedings potentially starting around 9:30 AM.
